Karn, the Great Creator.blurb: Powerful planeswalker that can lock down opposing artifacts and tutors artifacts from the sideboard. Ultimate protection for the deck with artifact activation lock.

Narset, Parter of Veils.blurb: Card advantage engine that draws cards and prevents opponents from drawing multiples. Forces discard against decks relying on card draw like Outcome combo.

Tezzeret the Seeker.blurb: Swiss-army planeswalker for artifact decks. Untaps artifacts, tutors artifacts into play, and can protect itself by making artifacts untargetable.

Tezzeret, Cruel Captain.blurb: Early planeswalker that damages opponents per artifact and tutors artifacts. Flexible threat that demands answers or threatens damage.

Blightsteel Colossus.blurb: Infect threat that's uncounterable and unblockable once in play. Primary win condition when tutored via Tinker or other artifact tutors.

Snapcaster Mage.blurb: Flash creature that flashes back instants and sorceries, adding tempo and enabling instant-speed threats. Turns expensive tutors or countermagic into card advantage.

Trinket Mage.blurb: Tutors 0-drop artifacts like Lotus Petal or Vexing Bauble. Flexible creature that provides consistency and setup while being a decent body.

Black Lotus.blurb: The most powerful mana source in Magic. Provides three mana of any combination for one mana, enabling explosive early turns and combo setups.

Lotus Petal.blurb: Fast mana that sacrifices for one mana. Enables turn-one combo starts and flashing back spells with Snapcaster or cascading effects.

Mana Crypt.blurb: Zero-cost mana artifact that generates colorless mana each turn. Risk-reward of damage from flipping, but critical for early game acceleration.

Mana Vault.blurb: Accelerant that produces mana without tapping. Enables turn-two Tinker kills and untaps via Voltaic Key for infinite mana potential.

Manifold Key.blurb: Versatile artifact that untaps creatures or artifacts and draws cards. Enables Time Vault combos and utility land activation chains.

Mox Emerald.blurb: Moxen provide free mana acceleration. Generate their respective colors without tapping, enabling explosive starts and full mana on turn one.

Mox Jet.blurb: Black mox. Provides free black mana for early discard or combo piece assembly.

Mox Opal.blurb: Affinity artifact that costs zero and produces white mana when artifacts are in play. Core of the fast mana engine.

Mox Pearl.blurb: White mox providing free white mana for early Balance or other white effects without investing mana.

Mox Ruby.blurb: Red mox that accelerates into red spells like Pyroblast or Shattering Spree.

Mox Sapphire.blurb: Blue mox. Provides free blue mana for early cantrips and Force of Will backup.

Sensei's Divining Top.blurb: Library manipulation that draws cards and controls the top of deck. Works with Tinker tutors and enables scrying for answers.

Sol Ring.blurb: Two mana acceleration per turn for one slot. The most efficient generic mana rock, enabling explosive turns and early threats.

Time Vault.blurb: Untapped via Voltaic Key or Manifold Key, generates infinite extra turns. Primary combo win condition once assembled.

Trinisphere.blurb: Taxing effect that increases spell costs. Sideboard tech against fast combo decks and stores strategies to lock opponents down.

Vexing Bauble.blurb: Artifact that can trigger Urza's Saga and tutored via Trinket Mage. Can prevent early spell casts, reducing immediate threats.

Voltaic Key.blurb: Untaps artifacts for Time Vault and Mana Vault combos. Enables infinite mana generation or extra turns when assembled.

Ancestral Recall.blurb: Instant card draw that refills the hand without a cost. One of the best cantrips in the format for pure card advantage.

Brainstorm.blurb: Cantrip that draws three and returns two, enabling tutoring setup and deck filtering. Works with Mystical Tutor for instant-speed tutoring.

Crop Rotation.blurb: Instant-speed land tutoring. Sacrifices a land to fetch any land into play, enabling mana ramp or utility land access. Crucial for finding Tolarian Academy or utility lands in response to threats.

Flusterstorm.blurb: Cheap blue counterspell that cantrips and generates copies. Flexible protection against fast combo and blue players with multiple spells.

Force of Negation.blurb: Pitched counterspell that stops future spells without needing mana. Flexible protection against blue opponents and opposing tutors.

Force of Will.blurb: The best counterspell in Magic. Pitched for free or cast for protection against any spell. Core of the blue control suite.

Mental Misstep.blurb: Negative cost that counters one-drop spells for free life loss. Strong early game protection against Thoughtseize, discard, and fast plays.

Mystical Tutor.blurb: Instant-speed library search for any blue card. Pairs with Brainstorm for instant tutoring or finds key answers at instant speed.

Paradoxical Outcome.blurb: Returns artifacts to hand for card advantage and mana generation. Can be a quick combo kill with enough cheap artifacts and mana sources.

Pyroblast.blurb: Cheap red instant that counters or damages blue spells and creatures. Flexible protection against blue-heavy metagames.

Vampiric Tutor.blurb: Black tutoring at instant speed. Finds Tinker, discard effects, or Cabal Therapy setups instantly in response to development.

Veil of Summer.blurb: Green protection that disenchants and hexproofs a creature against discard. Flexible defense against blue and black control.

Balance.blurb: Symmetric board wipe that resets resources. Powerful in decks running few creatures and lands versus opposing creature decks.

Cabal Therapy.blurb: Targetted discard that names a card. Exiles itself from graveyard for additional discard, providing both information and threat removal.

Demonic Tutor.blurb: Black tutoring for any card in the library. Finds Tinker, discard, or answers without restrictions, enabling any strategy.

Gitaxian Probe.blurb: Free card draw with phyrexian mana. Reveals opposing hand for information and triggers Snapcaster flashing back instants.

Ponder.blurb: Blue cantrip that sets up draws and enables tutoring chains. Instant-speed library manipulation for finding threats or answers.

Time Walk.blurb: Extra turn for just three mana. Historically broken, enabling setup of lethal or advancing position against unprepared opponents.

Timetwister.blurb: Wheel that shuffles both graveyards back into decks. Breaks symmetry in graveyard matchups and resets hand size for draw-heavy strategies.

Tinker.blurb: The namesake combo piece. Tutors Blightsteel Colossus into play at instant speed for a fast infect kill.

City of Brass.blurb: Mana utility land that produces any color for life loss. Supports five-color mana requirements without setback.

Gemstone Mine.blurb: Multiple color producer similar to City of Brass. Flexible mana source for splashing colors throughout the game.

Strip Mine.blurb: Land destruction utility. Removes key lands like Academy or Mishra's Workshop from opposing plays.

Mana Confluence.blurb: Utility land that freely produces any color. Four-of for consistency in five-color mana bases.

Tolarian Academy.blurb: The namesake engine. Generates mana per instant or sorcery in graveyard, enabling infinite mana combos and card advantage.

Urza's Saga.blurb: Land that tutors artifacts and creates Constructs. Flexibly searches for key pieces while generating threats.

Abrupt Decay.blurb: Uncounterable removal for creatures and permanents up to three mana. Flexible answers to Planeswalkers and utility permanents.

Archive Trap.blurb: Mill trap that exiles opposing libraries from deck. Anti-synergy with self-mill strategies and breaks fetch-land strategies.

Duress.blurb: Discard effect against non-creature spells. Sideboard card for removing key combo pieces and sorceries from control decks.

Energy Flux.blurb: Enchantment that taxes untapping artifacts. Sideboard lock against artifact-heavy decks like Outcome builds.

Hurkyl's Recall.blurb: Bounce effect that resets artifacts and draws cards. Strong against opposing mana bases and slows artifact synergy.

Mycosynth Lattice.blurb: Makes all cards artifacts for Karn activation. Combines with Karn's lock ability to shut down opposing plays entirely.

Pithing Needle.blurb: Artifact that names a card and prevents activation. Sideboard tech to lock planeswalkers and utility lands.

Portal to Phyrexia.blurb: Late-game board wipe that exiles creatures. Clears opposing threats when mana is available for a reset.

Shattering Spree.blurb: Artifact destruction that cantrips per artifact destroyed. Scales against fast artifact starts and opposing mana.

Swords to Plowshares.blurb: Instant removal that exiles creatures without affecting board state. Flexible answer to fast creature threats and evasive bodies.

The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale.blurb: Land that taxes creature activation. Sideboard land against token and creature-heavy strategies.

Tormod's Crypt.blurb: Graveyard hate artifact on a zero-drop body. Sideboard tech for decks relying on reanimation or self-mill strategies.
